titleInfo.title: Louisianans in the Military Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: Adolphe Gueymard oral history interview, 2005

name.description: Adolphe Gueymard was born in Carville, La., and attended Louisiana State University between 1930 and 1935. He was commissioned a second lieutenant in the Army Reserve, was called to active duty in 1942, and served in the 101st Airborne Division in Europe during World War II.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College--Students.
Ardennes, Battle of the, 1944-1945--Personal narratives, American.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Adolphe Gueymard discusses his family, his attendance and military training at Louisiana State University, and his training after being called to active duty. Gueymard described especially his service in Europe during the war at Normandy, France; Boekel, Holland; Bastogne, Belgium; and Berchtesgaden, Germany.
